meanings.definition: The customs, methods, or practices of academic life.
meanings.sent1: In our school, the academisms include attending lectures and studying in the library.
meanings.sent2: She was so immersed in the academisms of university life that she forgot about her hobbies.
meanings.sent3: The professor's dedication to the academisms was so strong that he even dreamed about grading papers.
meanings.sent4: The academisms of the university were like a secret code that only students and faculty understood.
meanings.sent5: The strict academisms of the institution made it challenging for students to balance their personal lives.

meanings.definition: Excessive emphasis on academic learning or scholarship.
meanings.sent1: His academisms led him to spend all his time studying, neglecting other aspects of life.
meanings.sent2: The academisms of the school pushed students to prioritize grades over everything else.
meanings.sent3: Her parents worried that her academisms would prevent her from enjoying her youth.
meanings.sent4: The academisms of the educational system created a competitive environment among students.
meanings.sent5: The pressure to excel academically resulted in unhealthy academisms among the students.

meanings.definition: The use of academic jargon or specialized language.
meanings.sent1: The professor's lecture was filled with academisms that confused the students.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the academisms in the research paper required a background in the field.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends joked about creating their own academisms to confuse others.
meanings.sent4: Her essay was criticized for using too many academisms that made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent5: The book was challenging to read due to the author's excessive use of academisms throughout.
